description: Functions with caching, memoization, and performance optimization

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="getExpensiveData" cache="true" ttl="300">
  <q:return>
    <!-- Expensive database query or calculation -->
    SELECT * FROM large_table
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Result is cached for 300 seconds (5 minutes)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="getUserData" cache="true" ttl="600" cache-key="user-{id}">
  <q:param name="id" type="string" required="true" />
  <q:return>
    SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {id}
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Each user ID cached separately with key 'user-{id}' for 10 minutes
Short cache for near-realtime data (30 seconds)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="getConfig" cache="true" ttl="86400">
  <q:return>
    SELECT * FROM config
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Cached for 24 hours (86400 seconds) for rarely-changing data

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="fetchData" cache="true" ttl="300" cache-condition="success">
  <q:param name="id" type="string" required="true" />
  <q:return>
    SELECT * FROM data WHERE id = {id}
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Only caches when query returns results successfully

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="getUserDashboard" cache="true" ttl="180" cache-key="dashboard-{session.userId}">
  <q:return>
    SELECT * FROM user_dashboard WHERE user_id = {session.userId}
  </q:return>
</q:function>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Each user's dashboard cached separately for 3 minutes
